model_answer:
The correct chronological order is:
Option B: 1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4 -> 5
The audio starts with the speaker signing off and introducing himself, followed by music and a siren. Then he begins explaining the guide-camera setup. Next, on the PHD2 Guiding screen, he enables the server to accept dither commands. After that, in Nebulosity, he uses the PHD Link to send a dither and move the telescope, which is accompanied by a loud mechanical whirr. Finally, in Sequence Generator Pro, he sets up Auto Guide to use Medium Dither every frame via PHD2.

The correct chronological order is: 1 -> 2 -> 3 -> 4 -> 5 -> 6 -> 7
Option A is the correct answer. The video starts with the speaker opening PHD2 Log Viewer, joking about the developer being "unidentified," and showing guide logs. This is followed by a loud noise interrupting his speech and him noting that it's a full moon. In Photoshop, he adds the text "SUBSCRIBE TO PEWDIEPIE" and demonstrates simulated dithering to reveal a hidden message after stacking. Next, he praises Sequence Generator Pro as set-and-forget and there is a short relaxing electronic music sting playing as he transitions to "quicker astronomy news." He then invites a Carina Nebula photo challenge and mellow jazz music starts and continues underneath. A title card "ASCOM (COMING TO MAC?!)" appears while he talks about a Rasa 8 review and ASCOM possibly coming to Mac, followed by short generic music. Finally, closing starry scenes with "Thanks for watching! Leave a like or subscribe" overlay appear with upbeat retro game-style music.
